titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4454) making appropriations for the Legislative Branch for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1995, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 103-532, by Mr. Derrick.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 4454 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered ordered without intervening motion except one motion to recommit, or to recommit with instructions if offered by Representative Young of Florida or a designee. Measure will be read by section. Specified amendments are in order. No amendment to the bill shall be in order except those printed in the report accompanying this resolution, to be offered in the order and manner specified in the report. All points of order against the amendments shall be waived. The chairman of the Committee of the Whole may postpone a request for a recorded vote on any amendment. The chairman may reduce to not less than five minutes the time for voting on any postponed question that immediately follows another vote, provided that the time for voting on the first vote in any series shall be not less than 15 minutes.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 170.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 249 - 177 (Roll no. 210).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 5/25/1994--Introduced. Sets forth the rule for the consideration of H.R. 4454 (making FY 1995 appropriations for the legislative branch).
